rdt.util

Class LPConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • rdt.util.LPConverter

  • public class LPConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to perform the Label-Powerset method effectively. The idea is to use this class to store the double-arrays for a specific key in a HashMap. Under the assumption that the double-array only contains the values 0 and 1 it is possible to create a hash-function with less collisions. The specific key can be used in the model as a single class. With this approach we do not have to compute the hash-value for each double-array over and over again. We can simply use the key to identify a specific class combination and if we want to get the specific class-combination for a key, we can get the double array by calling the method "getValues(int)". Furthermore one LPConverter can be used for all LPCollectors in a specific ensemble.
    Author:
    MK

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LPConverter()
      Creates a new LPConverter with an empty map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LPConverter

        public LPConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public int put(double[] values)
        If the double-array does not exist in the map it will be added. This method will return the hash-value of the double-array.
        Parameters:
        values - the double array which will be added and for which the hash-value will be computed
        Returns:
        the hash-value of the double array

      • getValues

        public double[] getValues(java.lang.Integer hashValue)
                   throws RDTException
        Returns the double array for a specific hash-value.
        Parameters:
        hashValue - the specific hash-value
        Returns:
        the corresponding double array
        Throws:
        RDTException
